blog.name: thisislakewood
blog.title: Lakewood, Texas
blog.description:
Lakewood, Texas presents the image of a simple town, a place for people to create a life without the terror that plagues other parts of the world. The illusion was always that it was safe, warmed by a Texan sun and a friendly hello from the commoners that have lived in Lakewood all their lives. But they learned their lesson with the kicking up of dust from a lone biker, to the cartels that moved like packs of coyotes along one another: Lakewood is a death sentence. Those who choose to live here take the responsibility that they might not live to see the sun set the next day. Families in power all want to dominate the town, a prime place for business on the border, while dodging the impending presence of FBI agents in town. Who can trust who? A good versus evil with the underlining tone that everyone is corrupted. Now, only one question remains: which side do you stand on?

Mobile Navigation
Opened since December 2018.

summary:
Behind the scenes of The Sound of Drums/The Last of the Time Lords  (Part Nine)  

Excerpt from Doctor Who Magazine #385 - David...
caption:
Behind the scenes of The Sound of Drums/The Last of the Time Lords 
(Part Nine) 

Excerpt from Doctor Who Magazine #385 - David Tennant interviewed by Benjamin Cook:

Does [ being a CGI creature for 25 page ] mean he gets a week off?

“The short answer is, I do. Yes. I finish a week before everybody else. I’m filming all of [episodes] 12 and 13 in three very, very intense weeks!  I’ve already recorded the lines for the little Yoda Doctor, so that’s 20-odd pages that I don’t have to be on set for. I had little spots stuck all over my face, and did that thing where you pull the expressions and they record everything. They’re going to matte my face onto this little homonculus creature. I had to do it full-length just to give them a reference of movement, and then just the face - not moving very much, but doing the lines.”

Talking of just the face, one of the story’s more surprising twists tickled Mr Tennant in particular. “The fact that Captain Jack turns out to be the Face of Boe just seems so utterly perfect,” chuckles David. “I really want to quiz Russell as to when he figured out that he could do that, because the Face only existed in the first place sort of by chance. It nearly got written out [of 2005′s The End of the World], so the fact that it’s become so integral, and that Captain Jack is Boe, is just perfect. I hooted when I first read that. I often wonder with Russell how much of it all just falls into place at three in the morning.”

Thank you to everyone who shared set photos!
[ Link to gifs of David recording for the CGI Doctor ]

Previous parts are available here: [one] [two] [three] [four] [five] [six] [seven] [eight]
Other behind-the-scenes photosets are available here

blog.name: talktoten
blog.title: The Doctor
blog.description:
| independent tenth doctor |
open to non-mutuals
roleplay & advice
rules / about

question: 🗡
answer:
Send “🗡” to ask my muse about one of their scars. (not accepting)

The scar sat inlaid into his collarbone, a bit deeper where the bone met skin and the sword hooked solid into his chest. Almost into his throat. It hadn’t been a particularly flattering look, really, to have his favourite tie done away with in one, smooth, knighting-ceremony-turned-murder-plot motion, but then - he supposed - murder plots didn’t often aspire to make their victims handsome. The Doctor frowned at it, in the mirror; it had been a proper swipe. It had scarred into a clean, thin line common to the clean cuts of smooth blades. It stretched from the top right, just above the collar, all the way down to his left hip. 

He didn’t like it much. 

Seriously, though, he hadn’t done a lot to earn it. The Doctor liked cool scars - he had one on his elbow that served good map of the London Underground, which a certain someone had seemingly taken as inspiration: scars could be cool. Another one, his mate Jack Sparrow had sunk a ship with him and the Doctor’s foot had been subject to a mild explosion in the process. Pirate scars. Useful scars. Scars could be cool. He was a cool guy. He liked cool scars.

Not scars that came from the patriachal monarch of a cleaning-appliance-resembling society being grumpy the Doctor had mistaken one of his boyfriends - who had been, the Doctor stressed in his head, very grumpily, hiding in a broom cupboard - for a mop. “’My boyfriend looks like a mop,’ he says,” the Doctor mumbled, and he pulled a face at the scar in the mirror - “’That’s no excuse’ - if you’re a mop hiding in a cleaning cupboard of course I reach for you,” he comPLAINED: this was ridiculous. He sighed, and rebuttoned his shirt, pleased to at least have an excuse, now. “I never do clean-up,” he reminded himself, in the mirror. That was rubbish. He never did clean-up, never stuck around for the paperwork, never stayed to fix his disasters (the Doctor sometimes came; he often saved lives; he ALWAYS left). He’d tried mopping up a puddle of cranberry-scented melted-Geokeo goo, and where had that led? Attempted murder. 

The king himself had called him in to thank him, pretended to knight him, and taken a swipe at him with a sword the size of a small tree. 

If anyone asked, he decided, he was telling them it was some mix of a car engine, ingenuity, and a large squid. Not a boring ol’ polygamous monarch’s defense of his poorly placed primary.

summary: What Doctor Who has Taught me....
body:
What Doctor Who has Taught me….

Be very aftraid of statues. Don’t take your eyes off them. Don’t even blink. Because if you blink they will kill you.

tags: I got chills when he did this
although David turned MAAN into a close second
caption:
David Tennant - Shakespeare Live! From the RSC1 (2016)

NOW the hungry lion roars,
And the wolf behowls the moon;
Whilst the heavy ploughman snores,
All with weary task fordone.
Now the wasted brands do glow,
Whilst the screech-owl, screeching loud,
Puts the wretch that lies in woe
In remembrance of a shroud.
Now it is the time of night,
That the graves, all gaping wide,
Every one lets forth his sprite,
In the churchway paths to glide:
And we fairies, that do run
By the triple Hecate’s team,
From the presence of the sun,
Following darkness like a dream,
Now are frolic; not a mouse
Shall disturb this hallowed house:
I am sent with broom before
To sweep the dust behind the door.

Now the Hungry Lion Roars
By William Shakespeare (1564–1616)

From “A Midsummer-Night’s Dream,” Act V. Scene 2

In the churchway paths to glide:
And we fairies, that do run
By the triple Hecate’s team,
From the presence of the sun,
Following darkness like a dream,
Now are frolic; not a mouse
Shall disturb this hallowed house:
I am sent with broom before
To sweep the dust behind the door.

Now the Hungry Lion Roars
By William Shakespeare (1564–1616)

From “A Midsummer-Night’s Dream,” Act V. Scene 2

summary: Inspired by a conversation with @imnotacommittee following THIS video from Georgia Tennant’s Instagram story yesterday (Thu 3rd...
caption:
Inspired by a conversation with @imnotacommittee following THIS video from Georgia Tennant’s Instagram story yesterday (Thu 3rd Jan 2019) about whether Alec and Roderick would be as patient with their little princesses.

We concluded that Alec would unhappily be coerced into tea parties with Belle, and Roderick would make it his life’s mission to memorise the names of all 42 of Abigail’s doll collection…

blog.name: insanityclause
blog.title: Still Really Good at Scrabble
blog.description: A work in progress. My grandmother always used to say, “Never tell all you know,” and I live by that. 55/8/6m. Reblogs do not equal agreement. Trying to be GB & ZS free since June 1/19. Send an ask about either? It will be deleted. Send a nasty ask? You’ll be reported and blocked, or messed with very publicly. Logica vincit. 👏😂🎈Avatar photo (c) me.

summary: Tom Hiddleston and Michael Fassbender to talk about their respective villains at ACE Comic Con Glendale
title: Tom Hiddleston and Michael Fassbender to talk about their respective villains at ACE Comic Con Glendale
body:
Tom Hiddleston and Michael Fassbender to talk about their respective villains at ACE Comic Con Glendale

Embed from Getty Images
Embed from Getty Images

ACE Comic Con has released its schedule for next weekend’s event in Glendale, Arizona, and Tom Hiddleston is once again closing the event talking about Loki — and seemingly without a host.

In addition, X-Men stars Michael Fassbender, Tye Sheridan and Alexandra Shipp will be at the event, alongside Jessica Jones actors Krysten Ritter and David Tennant, Daredevil‘s…

View On WordPress
